For the emphasis on commemoration and praise in lament, see Alexiou 2002: 55; for link between elegy, mournful content, commemoration and praise, see Alexiou 2002: 104-105. It is suggested, here, that the shift away from mournful content, which is evident in our remains of elegy, is not a change in elegy. Rather, this shift is the extension of certain themes that would have been found in mournful elegy which is entirely lost to us
